member.name: M:Darwinism.Centos.Interaction.HasCommand(System.String,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:Darwinism.Centos.Interaction.cat(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: read the file content of a specific

member.name: T:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp
member.summary: /proc/net/tcp
member.remarks: This file contains information about all TCP sockets that are currently open on the system. Each line in the file represents a TCP socket, and the fields in each line provide details about the socket’s state, the local and remote addresses and ports, and other related information.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.sl
member.summary: The socket’s slot (index) in the kernel’s socket table.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.local_address
member.summary: The local IP address and port number (in hexadecimal).

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.rem_address
member.summary: The remote IP address and port number (in hexadecimal), or 00000000:0000 if not connected.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.st
member.summary: The socket’s state (e.g., 0A for listening, 01 for established).

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.tx_queue
member.summary: The amount of data in the transmit queue.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.rx_queue
member.summary: The amount of data in the receive queue.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.tr
member.summary: Timing and retransmission information.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.tm_when
member.summary: Timing and retransmission information.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.retrnsmt
member.summary: Timing and retransmission information.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.uid
member.summary: The user ID of the process that owns the socket.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.timeout
member.summary: The socket’s timeout value.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.tcp.inode
member.summary: The inode number of the socket. This can be used to find the process using the socket by looking at ``/proc/[pid]/fdinfo/`` for the inode.

member.name: T:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.udp
member.summary:
/proc/net/udp
This file is similar to /proc/net/tcp, but it provides information about UDP sockets. Since UDP is connectionless, some of the fields that are relevant to TCP connections (like st for socket state) are not applicable or are set to default values.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.udp.st
member.summary: The socket’s state. For UDP, this is typically 07, which represents a socket that is waiting to receive packets.

member.name: P:Darwinism.Centos.proc.net.udp.drops
member.summary: The number of packets dropped by the socket.

member.name: T:Darwinism.Centos.PuTTY
member.summary: PuTTY automation combine with the hyper-V virtual machine for windows server

member.name: M:Darwinism.Centos.PuTTY.cacheServerKey
member.summary:
try to fix problem of
``` D:\web\RWeb>plink pipeline_submit@192.168.0.254 -P 22 -pw "pipeline_submit123" -batch qsub -cwd -e "/mnt/smb3/tmp/GCMS_autoTest/error" -o "/mnt/smb3/tmp/GCMS_autoTest/stdout" /mnt/smb2/.auto//GC-MS/auto_f1803b4671326cc1491b2cd8b7b9e7d3.sh The server's host key is not cached in the registry. You have no guarantee that the server Is the computer you think it Is. The server 's ssh-ed25519 key fingerprint is: ssh-ed25519 255 58:66:53:3d:3f:6c:a9:fb:8c:ad:af:bd:8c:dc:57:16 Connection abandoned. ```

member.name: M:Darwinism.Centos.PuTTY.Run(System.String)
